result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake S Reber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blake S Reber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Blake S Reber was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Must follow all rules of supervision.
Concurrent with: 13CF248

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. Cannot hold elected office. Other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Subject to Good Time & Work Release.
183 days sentence credit = TIME SERVED
$540.60 fines/costs still owing from previous sentence to be reduced to a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Blake S Reber in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Defendant Blake S Reber in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:33 am.
Exh 1-O&R-sentence credit.
Count 2-8 mo PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Credit for 183 days = time served.  Fines/costs-$540 still owing, reduced to civil judgment.  PCR.  11:54 am adj.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 1, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Blake S Reber in court, in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 10:38 am adj.  Def states his atty is Brian Smestad.  CT - File to be held for later today to speak w/Atty Smestad re SAR or rescheduling.  10:42 am adj.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.

CASES: 15CF354 & 13CF248. Defendant Blake S Reber in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Defendant Blake S Reber in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:59 am.  10:02 am.  Daniel Steffen appears for the State of Wisconsin.
13CF248-Motion to enter judgment-Court enters JOC as to Count 2.
15CF354-Count 2-NC plea.  CT accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  
Count 1-dismissed.
Waiver of PSI.  

SENTENCE:  
13CF248-Count 2-I&S 9 mo PCJ, subj to GT& WR.  Probation 1 yr.  $265.60 fine/costs, paid thru probation, ftp-judgment.  NO illegal substances & follow rules of supervision.  
15CF354-Count 2-w/h, probation up to 2 yrs.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  $290.60 fine/costs paid thru probation, ftp-judgment.  Follow rules of supervision.  Concurent w/ 13CF248.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  PCR.  1 day credit if revoked.  10:26 am adj.
